summary: An Ordinance approving the assessment roll of Local Improvement District No. 1877, for the improvement of Bagley Avenue and Corliss Avenue, each from North Forty-first Street to a point one hundred seventy-eight (178) feet north of the north line of North Forty-sixth Street; and certain parts of certain other streets and avenues therein named, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing concrete walks and wooden cross walks, together with all necessary appurtenances for the proper drainage, under Ordinance No. 19545, and levying and assessing the amounts thereof against each parcel and lot of land and part thereof shown in said roll, and providing for the collection thereof.
